column4: hello, I seem to be having a problem connecting directly to only one particular site, www.salesforce.com, from my new ubuntu 7.10 system, but it seems that if i try to use a proxy i can connect... I know the site is not blacklisting my IP or host, since other systems on the same network can connect perfectly.... can someone please offer some assistance
can you access the site at all or just not log in ?
i can ping it and it seems to connect, but the web pages just never load :S
i telnet'd to the site and did a http get and can get the page though
what ip address do you get when you ping it ?
same thing i get
can you load it via ip ?
it is strange, im on a live cd 7.10 and able to access the page fine w/ firefox
i get the same issue trying to open the IP address
and you said you can ping it ?
I tried booting the 7.10 live cd and got the same issue :P
the ip loaded the page for me.  and if a proxy works, sounds like SF is blocking your IP
cause if you use the live cd, the only difference is between me and you is your IP address
wouldn't that stop me from getting the page via telnet still though?
depends on how they block
have you tried different browsers on your box ?
I've tried opera, links, lynx, galeon, firefox....
all same issue ?
the strange thing is that there are other people in the same office with the same external IP address and they can access it perfectly too
yes same issue with all browsers, even links :P
can everyone else in the office connect and you are the only one who cant ?
just throwing out ideas, try a different nic in your computer ?
yes everyone else connects without an issue so i don't think they could be blocking the IP address :P
